intro: Gypsophila guvengorkii, commonly known as the Turfan gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to harsh, dry environments. It has small, narrow leaves and a compact growth habit, making it well-suited for xerophytic conditions. Gypsophila guvengorkii is often found in mountainous areas and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
